notes.title: Funding
notes.p: B.Z. was supported by the ÚNKP-19-3 New National Excellence Program of the Ministry for Innovation and Technology. APC and experimental work was partially supported by the National Research, Development and Innovation Office (grant number NKFIH KH_130379). The work of T.B., K.E., P.F. was supported by the grant NKFIH K_120118. The Project is supported by the European Union and co-financed by the European Social Fund (grant agreement no. EFOP-3.6.3-VEKOP-16-2017-00005); Comprehensive Development for Implementing Smart Specialization Strategies at the University of Pécs (EFOP-3.6.1.-16-2016-00004). The Research was financed by the Higher Education Institutional Excellence Program of the Ministry for Innovation and Technology in Hungary, within the framework of the “Innovation for a sustainable life and environment” thematic program of the University of Pécs (TUDFO/47138/2019-ITM). Investigation of the human clinical samples was partially supported by the One Health European Joint Programme. One Health EJP has received funding from the European Comission’s Horizon 2020 research and innovation programme under grant agreement No 773830.
